div.a: What I Learned While Live-Tweeting A Friend's Funeral

div.div: My decision to do this — which a number of people who follow me on Twitter reacted to with a combination of shock and/or disapproval — came about because of who my friend was.

div.a: A Guide To The Next Debate: Foreign Policy Takes The Stage

div.div: In the last of their three debates, President Obama and Mitt Romney will address issues ranging from Iran to the Afghan war to the unrest throughout the Arab world.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T5Mgww&via=Digg&text=A Guide To The Next Debate: Foreign Policy Takes The Stage

div.a: Windows 8 Is Easy, Just Ask This 3-Year-Old

div.div: In order to stem the tide of troubling publicity, the Supersite for Windows blog revealed this very sweet video that shows a very sweet 3-year-old proving that Windows 8 is sweetly simple.
Ayn Rand has fans in some unlikely countries.

div.a: A Man’s Muscle Power Influences His Beliefs

div.div: A new study found that regardless of country of origin or apparent ideology, strong men argued for their self interest: the poor for redistribution, the rich against it. Weaklings, however, were far less inclined to make the case that self-interest suggested they would.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VePvtc&via=Digg&text=A Man’s Muscle Power Influences His Beliefs

div.a: Cassette Tapes Are The Future Of Big Data Storage

div.div: The cassette tape is about to make a comeback, in a big way.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WKRQde&via=Digg&text=Cassette Tapes Are The Future Of Big Data Storage

div.a: Romney Staff, Press Face Off In Football Game

div.div: Top aides to Mitt Romney faced off against his traveling press corps Sunday morning in a game of flag football, with the Republican nominee conducting the coin toss to start play.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WW637e&via=Digg&text=Romney Staff, Press Face Off In Football Game

div.a: Here's Everything That Google Will Unveil At Its Android Event

div.div: Diverting some of the attention away from Apple’s ‘iPad mini’ unveiling on October 23 and Microsoft’s Windows Phone 8 event on October 29, Google is to unveil a number new devices and software improvements on the same day as Microsoft -- and we have all the details.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WVjQL6&via=Digg&text=Here's Everything That Google Will Unveil At Its Android Event

div.a: Photog Denied Permit Because His Mirrorless Camera Lacks A Mirror

div.div: There was once a time when you could more easily spot a professional photographer simply by glancing at the camera equipment in a person’s hands.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QH3Ff5&via=Digg&text=Photog Denied Permit Because His Mirrorless Camera Lacks A Mirror

div.a: iPad 4 Rumors Heat Up After Photos Leak

div.div: Apple is wildly expected to introduce a smaller 7.85-inch iPad mini at the company’s event on Tuesday, but that doesn’t mean a newer iPad isn’t making its way towards production for release in the spring.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TB4hmK&via=Digg&text=iPad 4 Rumors Heat Up After Photos Leak

div.div: Police were looking for a suspect after several people were shot at a hair salon near a mall Sunday morning in the Milwaukee area, witnesses and police said.
KIDS IN THE HALL OF DETENTION
More than 70,000 children are held in U.S. juvenile jails. Despite some changes in harsh sentencing laws, photographer Richard Ross found despair among kids stuck in the prison system.

div.a: The Strangely True Tale Of Johnny Appleseed

div.div: You've probably heard of the legendary character who traveled the Midwest planting trees, but he's not a myth. Johnny Appleseed's real name was John Chapman, and he was born in Massachusetts in either 1774 or 1775.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TnB98w&via=Digg&text=The Strangely True Tale Of Johnny Appleseed

div.a: Native American Named One Of Seven New Saints

div.div: Pope Benedict created seven new saints on Sunday including the first Native American to be canonized, as the Roman Catholic Church reaches out to its global flock to rebuff encroaching secularism.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QJ4nbu&via=Digg&text=Native American Named One Of Seven New Saints
